name: tech
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
short for
technical : relating to the knowledge, machines, or methods used in science and industry : We offer 24-hour online tech support for your device. Configuration refers to the technical specifications, known as "tech specs" of the computers and it includes processor speed, the amount of RAM, etc. He was worried that the tech rehearsal had been too brief - for example, the smoke machine wasn't working correctly.

[ U ] short for
technology , used especially to refer to digital technology, and the activities and businesses connected with it : The company produces an annual report on the state of European tech. the tech sector/industry tech entrepreneurs/start-ups/companies/stocks He worked for several years at one of the Silicon Valley tech giants. The recession and the bursting of the tech bubble account for many of the job losses. See also
biotech
cleantech
deep tech
edtech
femtech
fintech
high-tech
low-tech
[ U ] devices that use computer technology: They have all the latest tech. wearable tech such as fitness trackers It's wise to pack all your tech in your carry-on baggage.
[ C ] mainly US short for
technician : a worker trained in special skills, especially in science or engineering : He ended up as a lab tech in the department, using his chemistry degree from Alabama State College. Most vet techs work in veterinary clinics caring for domestic animals. Many pharmacy techs gain this certification because the added knowledge can give them an advantage when applying for jobs.
[ C ] short for
technical school : a school or college that specializes in teaching technical or practical subjects: I did my A level exams at the local tech. You could take a plumbing course at the tech.

Add to word list
Add to word list
abbreviation for technical or technological: used to describe a company, system, area of work, etc. that does or makes something involving technology: tech industry/sector/economy There has been a huge expansion of business for our tech companies. There's been a boom in the market for tech stocks. See also
technical
technological
a company that works in the area of technology: They bought shares in two of the world's biggest techs.
[ usually plural ] shares in companies that work in the area of technology: Stocks went lower but techs remained high.
